thread.title: Seymour’s Devante Farmer follows rule for interception TD
thread.title_full: Seymour’s Devante Farmer follows rule for interception TD - PrepXtra Story

author: Adam Greene
title: Seymour’s Devante Farmer follows rule for interception TD
text:
RUTLEDGE — A quick step and a pair of soft hands helped Seymour High School's Devante Farmer make the biggest play of the football game in a 26-0 shutout win at Grainger on Friday night.
Farmer had already carried the ball a couple of times, but playing cornerback with his back to the end zone, Farmer intercepted a pass and returned it 97 yards down the sideline for a touchdown with just 36 seconds to go in the opening half to give Seymour a 14-0 lead.
"We have a rule, you intercept the ball, you get to our sideline as fast as you can," Seymour coach Jerry Cooper said. "We want to run it back. Our kids did a really nice job getting out in front. That was a nice play right there."
Farmer's play stood out in a game filled with methodical, short-yardage offense. The Eagles (6-2, 4-1 Region 1-4A) scored three touchdowns on offense, two coming on drives of 12 plays or more.
"The game plan was to keep their big-play offense down," Grainger coach Chad Tate said. "We wanted to make them snap the ball and force some turnovers. We got some in the first half, but that interception was a big play for them. It was a huge momentum swing."
A turnover set up Grainger (4-4, 2-3) in Eagles' territory early in the first quarter. Grainger got inside the 10-yard-line three times in the opening half, but didn't score. It was the third shutout for Seymour this season.
"The key to the game was how well our defense held up after we turned over the ball on offense," Cooper said. "We had two first-half turnovers, plus we fumbled a punt. The defense kept us in the game and then Devante made the great big play that flipped the game around. If they score right there, it's 7-7 and a different ballgame at halftime."
Seymour opened the third quarter with a 13-play, 62-yard drive that Clayton Ogle finished with a 1-yard run. After Grainger turned the ball over on downs, the Eagles pushed the ball downfield with Jeremy Bryant and Isaiah Johnson doing most of the work on the ground. Jamal Ashley took it the final five yards for the score.
Bryant led Seymour with 18 carries for 88 yards and a touchdown.
Adam Greene is a freelance contributor.
